data.title: Feature Request: Default "find" settings (e.g., case sensitivity, regular expression settings)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27, 2016-09-22T13:06:49.879Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.0.0

SublimeText accepts default "find" preferences, such as case sensitivity and regular expression settings. It would be very, very nice of VSCode did likewise.

data.title: Restore ability to create a file from a link that points to non existing file
data.body:
We used to be able to click on a link to a file that does not exist and create that file, which imho was a very cool flow:
![editors](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/18922564/7b124b2e-85a9-11e6-9b90-55cbf2626c36.gif)

Ever since links.ts seems to use the openerService we lost this ability and clicking on a missing link does not even return a message to the user that the file does not exist.

data.title: Follow up on fix for #12750
data.body: Follow up on fix for #12750

data.title: App/Electron won't start on macOS Sierra 10.12

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.5.3 - OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12 I cannot get the latest .app to startup properly, either from the .app release or building from source. When trying to run the .app, it immediately exits without a crash message/etc. I went into the app bundle and tried to run Electron directly and it simply exits without warning/error. When building/running from source, everything compiles and is running (under `npm run watch`) but no Electron window shows. There are also no errors reported in the process. I know this is likely a config issue on my computer, but any debugging tips would be gladly appreciated. Thanks!

data.title: Allow to enter paths for creating/renaming files
data.body:
I waste a lot of time creating new files and complete paths for it, and I think there would be some good ideas to improve this.

For example, when using the "create new file" command (by right click or panel command): 

![](https://files.not.live/test_maps.html_-_valeo.map_2016-09-28_16-57-22.jpg)

VSC should be clever enough to understand that I request a complete path (existing or new) to put my file in, and create it all the way. A bit like the `touch` cli command.

Then again, a feature to automatically create a complete path to a file from a string would be great, like this (the example is from phpstorm) : 

![](http://files.italic.fr/screencast_2016-09-28_17-12-23.gif)

It would be great if it was possible like this, but even more if it could create the complete path directly.
Thanks!

data.title: Show preview editors while navigating through quick open results
data.body: I think it would be really useful to open a temporary editor while searching with CMD+P and open the first file found in the list so I can have an immediate feedback without having to guess what's inside.

data.title: Java: toString is not in auto-completion list
data.body:
Hi,
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a Java file which has 2 phrases:
   - `toString()`
   - `final long helloWorld = 0;`
2. Try auto-completion. While `helloWorld` is in the list, `toString` is not.

Would you please check? Personally I think it's weird. VSC can learn not-a-keyword `helloWorld`, but it cannot learn a... keyword `toString`?

Thanks,

---

_Edit:_ Related issue: #12619

---

_Edit_

I'm sorry I didn't mean keyword. I just wish that VSC doesn't filter out a phrase `toString`. Considering it accepts `helloWorld`, it should just simply accepts `toString`. Otherwise, it's weird.

Please don't think of "keywords", I know Java is not officially supported.

data.title: Files getting corrupted arbitrarily

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Linux (Ubuntu 16.04)

Steps to Reproduce:

While working on VScode, occassionally the code I'm working on gets corrupted - usually a few lines will get deleted or a bunch of spaces added. This usually happens on the file I'm editing, but not at the place I'm editing.

I'm working with the MS C/C++ extension, and clang-format. This could be the auto formatting, or it could be something inherent in the editor. 

A co-worker working with the same set-up experiences the exact same same issue.

data.title: Double-click highlighting separating white space

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.53.
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Type `abc def`
2. Double click the space before `def`

The white space between the tokens is highlighted instead of the leading or trailing word. This is inconsistent with highlighting in other applications.

data.title: High CPU usage.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VSCode with disabled extensions (`--disable-extensions`)
2. Open a JS file from this repo: https://github.com/artsy/emission
3. Scroll vertically (possibly 2 files in split panes)
4. Observe Code Helper process consuming ~100% CPU cycles.

Note that Im seeing ~15% CPU usage when idle, which also adds up quickly when running multiple editors.

[CPU-20160928T134657.cpuprofile.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/497997/CPU-20160928T134657.cpuprofile.txt)

data.title: NPE when editing file
data.body:
I get this NPE every time I edit a TS file in our repo, with the latest Insiders:

```

    at file:////Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:73:9242
```

data.title: tab size - bug
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.2.3
- OS Version: ubuntu 16.04 lts

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a .py file
2. At the end of for-loop line, e.g.(for i in x:), press enter. The bug is that the tab size is not correct. Tab size is the double of your actual tab.

data.title: lineNumbers: 'off' still renders a lineNumber div
data.body:
1. Open debug repl input or output window
2. Notice how all the text is indented
3. Both repl input and output have `'lineNumber': 'off'` - however the div for line numbers still gets rendered which indents the text
4. This also happens when you simple set `'editor.lineNumbers': 'off'`

Probably caused by Alex's line number refactoring to support relative line numbers. Investigating...

fyi @dbaeumer

data.title: WorkspaceConfiguration#update should make global optional
data.body: Updating a setting globally is rare and we should reflect that in the API by making the argument optional.

data.title: Outdated extensions are not removed anymore
Feature request: add ability to manually check for updates
data.body:
Related with this #12817, it will be cool if there will be ability to have full control over app update process. I mean disable automatic updates but have ability to check for updates manually.

Right now I need to go in "User Settings", enable automatic update, restart VSCode, update VSCode, go to "User Settings" again and disable automatic updates. Over complicated, isn't it.

And we can see from many other apps, many of them have such ability to disable automatic updates, but preserve ability to check for updates manually (or install them in other time, if user wants this).

data.title: Inspect a Webview
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.4.0, 1.5.3 - OS Version: 10.11.6 Is there a way to inspect the contents of a Webview? All I see is an empty object even though there should be some content. I created a new markdown document with this in it: ``` Markdown ======== 1. hi 2. world ``` and then showed the preview. What I see in the ispector when I select the Webview is this: I've tried the Shadow-DOM option in the inspector. Thanks a lot for your help.

data.title: As a user, I should be able to see the extension dependencies in the extension editor
data.body: Render dependencies of an extensions in the editor

data.title: Preview window and zoom rendering issue.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27, 2016-09-22T08:50:42.185Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use the zoom feature on the editor (Ctrl/=)
2. Open the Preview Window.
   The Preview window will not open zoomed. It will only show as much text as is visible in the editor window. Using the zoom hot keys causes the Preview Window to jump to the correct zoom.
   If you open a second Preview Window by clicking on a link the new Preview Window is correctly zoomed. However if you close the second Preview window the firs one reverts to its original unzoomed state.
   ![vs code zoom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16834359/18905731/68008fe8-855c-11e6-879c-33657e0ff1cf.png)
